definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

sentences.english: The will actually contains the main switch which directs all the actions of the human organism.
sentences.chinese: 意志力实际上包含着指挥人体组织所有行动的总开关。

sentences.english: Repair leaks can simply switch temporarily by the flow or control.
sentences.chinese: 一时修不了的漏水，干脆用总开关暂时控制水流也好。

sentences.english: Know how to turn off your gas and water mains.
sentences.chinese: 知道如何关闭煤气和水管的总开关。

sentences.english: The Army Research Office is holding a closed conference on kill switches in mid-April.
sentences.chinese: 陆军研究处在4月中旬会就“总开关”召开闭门会议。

sentences.english: Replacement of the LED lights, please turn off the lamp power supply;
sentences.chinese: 安装更换灯具前请关闭电源总开关。

definition: power switch/gas valve/to open the city (or frontier) gate/to open and close/to switch on and off
bolt (for locking a window, cabinet etc)/(electrical) plug
(of a circuit breaker or switch) to trip
abbr. for 搭鐵接線|搭铁接线/chassis grounding (i.e. using the chassis as ground, to serve as a return path for current in an electric circuit)
